summary: An email from an unspecified sender, likely a law enforcement or official source, summarizing the preliminary findings of Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy conducted by the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME). It states the findings are consistent with suicide by hanging/strangulation, but the final determination is pending toxicology results and interviews with the guards who discovered him. The email notes specific injuries found on Epstein's body.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the autopsy report; his death by hanging is described with preliminary findings consistent with suicide.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: The doctor from the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner who performed the autopsy on Jeffrey Epstein. The final findings are pending their review of additional information.

persons.name: NYPD Det
persons.context: The NYPD detective from the OCME liaison unit who provided the information about Epstein's autopsy findings and injuries to the email's author.

connections.description: The NYPD detective from the OCME liaison unit is the source of information for the medical examiner's (Dr.) findings, indicating a working relationship between law enforcement and the medical examiner's office.
The medical examiner (Dr.) performed the autopsy on Jeffrey Epstein and is responsible for determining the cause and manner of his death.

events.title: Preliminary Autopsy Report Communication
events.description: An email is sent summarizing the just-completed autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein, with preliminary findings described as consistent with suicide by hanging/strangulation.

events.title: Epstein's Autopsy
events.description: The autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein is completed by the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME). The preliminary findings note a broken hyoid bone and shoulder injuries consistent with hanging.

keyFacts: The preliminary autopsy findings for Jeffrey Epstein, completed on or before August 11, 2019, were described as 'consistent with strangulation/hanging themselves.'
The medical examiner's office stated there was 'NO REASON to suspect or suggest Epstein did not hang himself' at that preliminary stage.
The final autopsy findings and death certificate were pending a toxicology report and interviews with the first guards on the scene who discovered Epstein's body.
Specific injuries noted included a broken hyoid bone (miswritten as 'hiatal bone') and injuries to the left shoulder, which the source stated were consistent with hanging and convulsions.
